result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Kloske, Gideon S

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Gideon S Kloske in court.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde in court for Gideon S Kloske.  Attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin. Discussion held on defendant's motion. Atty Van Kerkvoorde requests that court allow defendant be able to drive under certain circumstances. Atty Barrington heard; opposes modification of bond due to defendant's driving behavior. Court heard; motion to modify bond is denied at this time. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:23 AM Defendant Gideon S Kloske in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Def to apply for SPD. Court sets another review.
Review hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gideon S Kloske in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein (refusing SPD after today) in court for Gideon S Kloske. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
